summary: The second edition to my Immersive Stables mods is here. This mod makes changes to the existing Vanilla Stables of Skyrim, making them more immersive and realistic by adding small and simple objects, rearranging certain things, and adding more detail.
descriptionHtml:
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/LYgiArV.jpg[/IMG]


[size=6]About this Mod[/size]

[size=4]Allow me to introduce Immersive Stables - Vanilla Edition.

While my first mod to this series adds new and small stables to the village inns around Skyrim, this mod expands and makes changes to the Vanilla stables.

You will find that there is much more clutter, new buildings, a few horses added (cannot be purchased, these horses are simply owned by the stable master), and more immersion. It makes the stables more realistic. cold regions have more shelter, more warmth, and a cozier feel while the warmer regions may have less hay, but still added immersion.

[color=royalblue]--> More buckets, shovels, and pitchforks added.
--> More hay for more comfortable looking sleeping areas.
--> Hay beds for poor folk who may need a place to rest.
--> Added clutter such as crates, lanterns, and sacks.
--> Expanded stable areas in certain cities.
--> More horses added to give more of a "stable" feel without over-doing it.
--> Neat and clean, remaining immersive without obsessive clutter - No performance loss.
--> Cleaned with TES5 Edit.[/color]

[size=4]How to Install/Uninstall[/Size]
1) Use NMM or another mod manager
2) Install Manually by dragging and dropping the file into your Skyrim Data folder
3) To Uninstall - Delete the esp file "Immersive Stables - Vanilla Edition" from the Data folder or uninstall using mod manager

[size=5] My other mods:[/size]

[URL=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52391/?][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/PlPccow.jpg?1[/IMG][/URL]


[/size]

[U][B]Changelog[/B][/U]


[U][B]Known issues/Compatibility:[/B][/U]

May conflict with other mods that make changes to the stables in Whiterun, Riften, Solitude, Markarth, and Windhelm.
author: FatalxSyn
